alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 04 at 10:00AM EST until January 04 at 10:30AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... North central Aiken County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Saluda County in central South Carolina... * Until 1030 AM EST. * At 1000 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Johnston, or 14 miles southwest of Batesburg-Leesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Ridge Spring around 1015 AM EST. Batesburg-Leesville around 1030 AM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Ward, Hibernia and Monetta. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
